item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, November 19, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Fair coins tend to land on the side they started: Evidence from 350,757 flips (163 points | 82 comments)
2. A subtle layout bug in Google Search: When CJK text-wrapping meets float (26 points | 5 comments)
3. Show HN: Rust library for numerical integration of real-valued functions (66 points | 18 comments)
4. Show HN: Physically accurate black hole simulation using your iPhone camera (7 points | 4 comments)
5. Why I hate the index finger (1980) (53 points | 19 comments)
6. Justpaid.ai (YC W23) Is Hiring Software Engineers in Silicon Valley ( | hide)
7. How to Build a Chess Engine and Fail (48 points | 2 comments)
8. A Man of Parts and Learning Fara Dabhoiwala on the Portrait of Francis Williams (3 points | discuss)
9. Shift Left Is the Tip of the Iceberg (44 points | 9 comments)
10. Austen and Darwin converged on the question of beauty (23 points | 4 comments)
11. OpenStreetMap's New Vector Tiles (226 points | 64 comments)
12. A joke in approximating numbers raised to irrational powers (24 points | discuss)
13. Launch HN: Regatta Storage (YC F24) – Turn S3 into a local-like, POSIX cloud FS (503 points | 267 comments)
14. Rim/Blackberry tales – reply all (95 points | 41 comments)
15. Uno Platform Studio Featuring Hot Design (25 points | 4 comments)

18. Scientific American's departing editor and the politicization of science (281 points | 471 comments)
19. Red Hat and Microsoft Bringing RHEL to WSL (25 points | 7 comments)
20. Bose buys McIntosh, storied maker of high-end luxury audio equipment (12 points | 7 comments)
21. Maslow 4: Large format CNC routing made accessible (186 points | 60 comments)
22. Ask HN: How do you communicate in a remote startup? (88 points | 115 comments)
23. 20 years of Google Scholar (366 points | 152 comments)
24. Two undersea cables in Baltic Sea disrupted (426 points | 724 comments)
25. A Woman Who Defined the Great Depression (38 points | 14 comments)
26. DOJ will push Google to sell off Chrome (911 points | 1020 comments)
27. MailCatcher runs a super simple SMTP server (269 points | 85 comments)
28. Hyperfine: A command-line benchmarking tool (187 points | 39 comments)
29. Gliimly is a programming language for web services (43 points | 50 comments)
30. The tragedy of running an old Node project (191 points | 275 comments)
